evidence: A signal cannot be both time-limited and band-limited at the same time.
If a signal is strictly limited in time - meaning it exists only within a certain interval - its frequency spectrum will stretch infinitely.
In practice, we often work with signals that are approximately time-limited and approximately band-limited.
This approximation, along with clever techniques like sampling, zero padding, and windowing, allows us to do what might seem impossible
